Class MapController

      • canPlaceSettlement

        public boolean canPlaceSettlement(VertexLocation vertLoc)
        Description copied from interface: IMapController
        This method is called whenever the user is trying to place a settlement on the map. It is called by the view for each "mouse move" event. The returned value tells the view whether or not to allow the settlement to be placed at the specified location.
        Specified by:
        canPlaceSettlement in interface IMapController
        Parameters:
        vertLoc - The proposed settlement location
        Returns:
        true if the settlement can be placed at vertLoc, false otherwise
        See Also:
        canPlaceRoad(shared.locations.EdgeLocation)

      • placeRoad

        public void placeRoad(EdgeLocation edgeLoc)
        What happens to get to this point:

        startMove(shared.definitions.PieceType) is called.

        MapView.startDrop(shared.definitions.PieceType, shared.definitions.CatanColor, boolean) opens a new MapOverlay, which is a view. This is given the special controller MapView.overlayController.

        It also keeps an additional internal MapComponent which is the half of the map view which actually handles user input. In MapOverlay, it sets the MapOverlay controller to the special controller.

        The "place a road" modal is shown and the user can place one (or possibly cancel). Once a location is chosen and the user clicks, the MapComponent.mouseAdapter's MouseAdapter.mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent) calls its controller's IMapController.placeRoad(shared.locations.EdgeLocation) function. In the end, this will call the special MapView.overlayController's.

        That then cancels any drops in the overlay, closes the modal, and uses its parent's view's MapView.getController() to get the actual map controller, which then calls this function. Whew.

        Specified by:
        placeRoad in interface IMapController
        Parameters:
        edgeLoc - The road location

      • placeRobber

        public void placeRobber(HexLocation hexLoc)
        Since placing the robber and stealing is a single call to the server, all server communication is done in robPlayer(client.data.RobPlayerInfo).

        We need to open the robber modal to choose what to steal.

        Specified by:
        placeRobber in interface IMapController
        Parameters:
        hexLoc - The robber location
        See Also:
        placeRoad(shared.locations.EdgeLocation)

      • startMove

        public void startMove(PieceType pieceType)
        This is called by other controllers, which must call the view.

        User selects a resource card in the ResourceBarView.

        The equivalent function e.g. ResourceBarController.buildRoad() is called. ResourceBarController.executeElementAction(client.resources.ResourceBarElement)

        The action created by RightPanel.RightPanel(client.map.IMapController) and RightPanel.createStartMoveAction(client.map.IMapController, shared.definitions.PieceType) is called.

        This function is called.

        How startMove with robbing is called is unknown. It looks like it may be completely controlled by the MapController possibly. Somehow the RollController will need to be involved.

        Specified by:
        startMove in interface IMapController
        Parameters:
        pieceType - The type of piece to be placed

      • playSoldierCard

        public void playSoldierCard()
        PlayDevCardView.btnGrpPnlListener plays a soldier card when selected in the modal.

        It calls DevCardController.playSoldierCard(), which then calls this function with an action created in RightPanel.RightPanel(client.map.IMapController).

        Robber placement should be initiated.

        Specified by:
        playSoldierCard in interface IMapController

      • playRoadBuildingCard

        public void playRoadBuildingCard()
        Description copied from interface: IMapController
        This method is called when the user plays a "road building" progress development card. It should initiate the process of allowing the player to place two roads.
        Specified by:
        playRoadBuildingCard in interface IMapController
        See Also:
        playSoldierCard()

      • robPlayer

        public void robPlayer(@Nullable
                      RobPlayerInfo victim)
        First, placeRobber(shared.locations.HexLocation) is called to physically move the robber. Then, the robber view (modal) is shown.

        When a player to rob is selected with a button click, this is called.

        If this is being interpreted correctly, the new robber location has already been chosen at this point.

        Specified by:
        robPlayer in interface IMapController
        Parameters:
        victim - The player to be robbed
        See Also:
        RobView.actionListener
